Journal.Title: Journal of cardiopulmonary rehabilitation and prevention

Article.ArticleTitle: Improvements in Dyspnea Following Traditional Pulmonary Rehabilitation in Patients With Long COVID.

AffiliationInfo.Affiliation: Center for Cardiac, Pulmonary and Vascular Fitness, The Miriam Hospital, Providence, Rhode Island (Drs Buckley and Simmons and Mss Mahoney and Pierce); Department of Psychiatry and Human Behavior, Alpert Medical School of Brown University, Providence, Rhode Island (Dr Buckley); Center for Alcohol and Addiction Studies, Brown University School of Public Health, Providence, Rhode Island (Dr Wycoff); Department of Medicine, Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, and Sleep Medicine, Alpert Medical School of Brown University, Providence, Rhode Island (Dr Simmons); and Department of Kinesiology, University of Rhode Island, Kingston, Rhode Island (Dr Adami).

MedlineCitation.CoiStatement: The authors declare no conflict of interest. The results of the study are presented clearly, honestly and without fabrication, falsification, or inappropriate data manipulation.
